descript.abstract:
Number of mammal species, by terrestrial ecoregion.
We compiled data on terrestrial mammals by querying the WWF WildFinder database for species occurrences by ecoregion. The WWF WildFinder database is a spatially explicit online database of vertebrate species occurrences by ecoregion.
These data were displayed in a map published in The Atlas of Global Conservation (Hoekstra et al., University of California Press, 2010). More information at http://nature.org/atlas.
descript.purpose: biogeography, biodiversity conservation and priority setting.

Itoua, W.W. Wettengel, Y. Kura, P. Hedao, and K. Kassem. 2001. Terrestrial ecoregions of the world: A new map of life on Earth. BioScience 51(11):933-938.

procstep.procdesc: Consolidated Data Basin Info: Dataset copied. (\\SASQUATCH\DATA\ecoregions\version_2\WWF_terr_eco.mdb) Dataset copied. Dataset copied. Metadata imported. (D:\atlas_online\terr_metadata.xml)

attr.attrdef: Area of each individual polygon in square kilometers. The attribute area_km2 is a sum of this field for each ecoregion as a whole.
A unique number for each ecoregion within each biome nested within each realm.
This number is created by combining REALM, BIOME, and ECO_NUM, thus creating a unique numeric ID for each ecoregion.
Ecoregion Symbol - Used to display the map in ArcInfo
unique code that uses realm text, biome number and ecoregion number.
number of mammal species by terrestrial ecoregion
number of mammal species by terrestrial ecoregion for map labels
